restaurants.google_reviews:
[{"author_name": "Gc Pro", "author_url": "https://www.google.com/maps/contrib/116452533532188720161/reviews", "language": "en", "original_language": "en", "profile_photo_url": "https://lh3.googleusercontent.com/a-/ALV-UjXbwYvNFkK6A4HoWyrtZcfVWSH7TX4UxcoIcmZNKIXLrL8ZxH4=s128-c0x00000000-cc-rp-mo", "rating": 5, "relative_time_description": "6 months ago", "text": "Last Thursday, I brought my team here for a company event, and I couldn’t be happier with the experience. From the moment we walked in, the energy of the restaurant was incredible. Despite it being a busy night, the atmosphere felt lively and welcoming without feeling chaotic.

The food was absolutely amazing—each dish was thoughtfully prepared, perfectly seasoned, and beautifully presented. Every member of my team was raving about their meals, and it’s clear that the kitchen staff puts genuine care and passion into their work.

The service was equally impressive. Even with the restaurant being packed, we were made to feel like the only table there. The staff was attentive, professional, and personable, ensuring that every detail of our evening was taken care of seamlessly. Drinks were refilled promptly, special requests were handled without hesitation, and they even took the time to ask if everything was to our liking multiple times throughout the night.

This restaurant really sets the standard for how to handle large groups without sacrificing quality or service. I genuinely recommend this place to anyone looking for incredible food, outstanding service, and a vibrant atmosphere. Whether it’s for a company event like ours or a personal dinner, you won’t be disappointed. You could tell they use fresh oil because there was no taste of old fry oil, I really appreciate that. The textures were spot on, and I enjoyed all three selections.

For dessert we ordered a Peanut Butter Dome $12.95 & a Chocolate Dome $12.95 The presentation was fabulous! They were decadent, rich and over the top. Everything a dessert should be 😉 I am a huge peanut butter fan and always have to order if I see a dessert w it. So so glad we did!

PX Mediterranean Grill
3558 N Ocean Blvd,
Fort Lauderdale, FL 33308

restaurants.google_reviews:
[{"author_name": "Joao Gomes", "author_url": "https://www.google.com/maps/contrib/110663608102082926732/reviews", "language": "en", "original_language": "en", "profile_photo_url": "https://lh3.googleusercontent.com/a/ACg8ocIvfTygQmxXJNdu8vae_Xl_ladUKT3Khh_9y8WDcW7S1wIWA7Q=s128-c0x00000000-cc-rp-mo-ba2", "rating": 1, "relative_time_description": "9 months ago", "text": "I recently visited Chai Berry for takeout and had a deeply concerning experience regarding food safety that must be addressed. Upon receiving my order, the orange juice was missing, so I returned to the counter to request it. While waiting, I witnessed the server retrieve the orange juice from a pitcher in the fridge that was visibly full of mold, with a dark ring of mold inside and the lid also covered. The pitcher was almost empty, and as the server shook it to pour the remaining juice, more mold was disturbed and released into the juice.

When I pointed out the black, slimy material floating in my juice, the server tried to dismiss it as pulp from “fresh juice.” I immediately asked to see the pitcher, and upon inspection, it was clearly contaminated with mold. It is unfortunate that I didn’t have my phone with me at the time, or I would have taken a picture of the pitcher to document the severity of the situation. The general manager refunded my order, but this is not enough to address the seriousness of the issue.

To make matters worse, when I opened the rest of my order in my car, I discovered that the muffin I had ordered was also moldy. This raises serious concerns about the overall cleanliness and food safety at this establishment. How many other customers have consumed mold-contaminated food or drinks?

It is unacceptable for any restaurant to serve food and beverages that could potentially harm customers. Health and safety protocols exist for a reason, and Chai Berry is clearly failing to follow them. I strongly urge the health department to conduct a thorough audit of this restaurant to ensure the safety of future customers.

This review is lengthy because this situation is truly alarming. I hope the management takes this matter seriously and makes the necessary changes to ensure the safety of their patrons.", "time": 1728532571, "translated": false}, {"author_name": "Estelle D", "author_url": "https://www.google.com/maps/contrib/106534309720743921332/reviews", "language": "en", "original_language": "en", "profile_photo_url": "https://lh3.googleusercontent.com/a/ACg8ocK53iM8SgJQ66985kvq-WB9d8lg9yX9p9e9AyocpmHzioyiAcs=s128-c0x00000000-cc-rp-mo-ba4", "rating": 5, "relative_time_description": "a year ago", "text": "We ordered poke bowls. It's in a kiosk in the middle of the mall with some tables and chairs next to it. The ladies working were kind and helpful. Just a really great spot that I'll keep coming back to.", "time": 1720203751, "translated": false}, {"author_name": "EЯиʂɬ", "author_url": "https://www.google.com/maps/contrib/116697272903300157863/reviews", "language": "en", "original_language": "en", "profile_photo_url": "https://lh3.googleusercontent.com/a-/ALV-UjVQms3Gl51JXEX39bTOLn_FiFYd_aOltk5REr637jdayS8nFEbJ=s128-c0x00000000-cc-rp-mo-ba4", "rating": 5, "relative_time_description": "a year ago", "text": "Review of Cielito Artisan Pops

I recently had the pleasure of visiting Cielito Artisan Pops, and it was an exceptional experience from start to finish. Nestled in a cozy, inviting space, this little gem specializes in gourmet popsicles that are as beautiful to look at as they are delicious to taste.

The first thing that struck me was the ambiance. The shop is impeccably clean, and the decor is vibrant and modern, perfectly reflecting the colorful and creative nature of their offerings. The staff were incredibly friendly and knowledgeable, eager to share their passion for these delightful treats.

Now, onto the pops themselves. Cielito Artisan Pops offers an impressive variety of flavors, both classic and inventive. Whether you have a sweet tooth or prefer something more refreshing, there is something for everyone. I tried a few different flavors, and each one was a revelation. The fruit-based pops were bursting with fresh, natural flavors, and the cream-based pops were rich and decadent without being overly sweet.

One standout for me was the mango chili pop. It struck the perfect balance between sweet and spicy, with real chunks of mango and a subtle chili kick that left my taste buds tingling. The attention to detail in every pop is evident – from the high-quality ingredients to the artistic presentation.

Cielito Artisan Pops also caters to various dietary preferences, offering vegan, dairy-free, and gluten-free options, making it an inclusive treat spot for everyone. This thoughtful consideration for different needs adds to the overall positive experience.

In addition to the fantastic pops, Cielito Artisan Pops also offers a selection of coffees and other beverages, making it a great spot to relax and unwind. The pricing is reasonable, especially considering the quality and craftsmanship that goes into each pop.

In conclusion, Cielito Artisan Pops is a must-visit for anyone in search of a delightful, gourmet treat. The combination of exquisite flavors, beautiful presentation, and friendly service makes it a standout destination. I can’t wait to return and try more of their delicious creations!", "time": 1722027556, "translated": false}]

I can’t even describe it so look at the photos.", "time": 1740072357, "translated": false}, {"author_name": "Frank Garcia", "author_url": "https://www.google.com/maps/contrib/108125164798293750787/reviews", "language": "en", "original_language": "en", "profile_photo_url": "https://lh3.googleusercontent.com/a-/ALV-UjXGfePFisYnRD9-OlgVxHYB8S-f4wfcSxsTanwqaHxnyEv3-O1T=s128-c0x00000000-cc-rp-mo-ba6", "rating": 3, "relative_time_description": "a month ago", "text": "I had high expectations for Madame Olivia but it didn’t do it for me.

Let’s start with what they really excel at, decoration and ambiance. The place is beautiful, new, nice fixtures and with abundance of light. However, quality is not there, at least that was my experience.

I had their sunny breakfast which consists of a small salad, bacon,  fried eggs and bread. It was alright nothing it would blow your mind. The bread arrived after I had already finished. Although, the bacon was pretty good, that was my favorite part of that dish.

The shakshuka, a simple dish, nothing complicated, was not good at all.  It was watery and lacking spices. I make better shakshuka at home.

The coffee was 3 out of 5. It was weak and the coffee and milk were kind of separated. This is not how it is supposed to be. And $6.50 for a flat white and/or a latte is excessive, specially when quality is not there.

restaurants.google_reviews:
[{"author_name": "hilary doan", "author_url": "https://www.google.com/maps/contrib/105069281138261389429/reviews", "language": "en", "original_language": "en", "profile_photo_url": "https://lh3.googleusercontent.com/a-/ALV-UjVsR6uD6EX464E803oY4-yIN7YFzxIQGRyopsty0FQ8gRWCsYSS=s128-c0x00000000-cc-rp-mo", "rating": 4, "relative_time_description": "3 months ago", "text": "We had a great time at Dixie Barbecue in Aventura! The American BBQ diner vibe and atmosphere were spot on, making it feel like a cozy, laid-back spot for a good meal.

We started with the loaded brisket fries, and they were amazing. The fries were topped with tender, flavorful pulled brisket, special house sauce, fresh tomatoes, onions, and we added pickled jalapeños for an extra kick. The combination of flavors was delicious!

The burgers were also fantastic—thick, juicy, and cooked just right. Everything came out fresh, and the service was friendly and efficient. The curly fries were nice and crispy, just how we like them!

Overall, we had a great experience and will definitely be back. Nestled in the heart of Miami Beach, Lenny's Kosher is a culinary gem that has captured the hearts (and taste buds) of pizza aficionados far and wide. As a self-proclaimed pizza connoisseur, I can confidently attest that Lenny's Kosher is not just a pizza joint; it is an experience that transcends the ordinary.

From the moment you step foot into Lenny's, you are enveloped in a warm, inviting ambiance that sets the stage for an unforgettable dining journey. The aroma of freshly baked dough and savory toppings wafts through the air, tantalizing your senses and whetting your appetite for the feast to come.

The menu at Lenny's Kosher is a veritable symphony of flavors, featuring an array of mouthwatering pizzas that cater to every palate. Whether you are a traditionalist who revels in the classic Margherita or a bold explorer seeking culinary adventure with the Mediterranean-inspired Za'atar pizza, Lenny's has something to delight and surprise you.

What truly sets Lenny's Kosher apart, however, is the impeccable quality of their ingredients. Each pizza is crafted with care and precision, using only the freshest, finest components sourced from trusted suppliers. The result? A symphony of flavors that dance on your taste buds, leaving you craving more with each delectable bite.

But Lenny's Kosher is more than just a purveyor of exceptional pizzas; it is a testament to the power of passion and dedication in the culinary arts. The staff at Lenny's exude warmth and hospitality, ensuring that every guest feels like family from the moment they walk in. Their commitment to excellence shines through in every aspect of the dining experience, from the attentive service to the artful presentation of each dish.

In conclusion, Lenny's Kosher is a true culinary treasure in Miami Beach, a place where pizza lovers can indulge in the finest creations and create lasting memories with friends and loved ones. If you are in search of the best pizza in town, look no further than Lenny's Kosher – where every slice tells a story of passion, quality, and unparalleled flavor.

🌟🍕 **Lenny's Kosher: Where Pizza Dreams Come True** 🍕🌟", "time": 1718869790, "translated": false}, {"author_name": "S Gregory", "author_url": "https://www.google.com/maps/contrib/116169171950533558081/reviews", "language": "en", "original_language": "en", "profile_photo_url": "https://lh3.googleusercontent.com/a/ACg8ocLttzdS-zCzdIuESN9i60IvqyfMxwBIi7TiNrWTyj3gNJV2=s128-c0x00000000-cc-rp-mo-ba5", "rating": 4, "relative_time_description": "6 years ago", "text": "My husband decided he wanted Pizza when we were visiting Miami Beach. Once via Uber eats and once via Lenny’s directly.

we’re from NY and the pizza was ok at best , the Greek salad was good and the French fries were ok. You’re not getting anything special but you’re getting basic pizza shop food.

Review on the service is bad.  The store was overwhelmed and provided terribly slow service. The phone lines were always busy and when I finally got thru they did accommodate and turn on u er eats for me which turned out a little slow but overall ok.

The problem in service came when we ordered with them directly. The nice young lady in the phone said it can take up to 1.5 hours and we agreed to that but then the food took a little over 3 hours to arrive. Repeated calls to find out if our order is coming or not and they just hung up on us.

A word to Lenny’s: all you had to do was be honest and we would have ordered elsewhere, you would have lost a $80 dollar order but you would have kept a customer and probably gotten a 5 star review on my previous order.

UPDATE: I actually decided to give them a try in person and that was a huge mistake. The pizza was bland,  undercooked and very oily it was so bad I couldn’t even eat it. I’m a business owner myself, so I understand how damaging they can be but the fact of the matter is this place has earned its one star.

I’ll start off by saying the food is great… If you can ever get a chance to eat it.  Before I move to Florida, I was visiting a few times a year and finding authentic Israeli Shawarma is one of the most impossible things to do where I’m from so every time I would visit, I put this on my list of places to go and every single time they were closed. Just random stuff too.  Like somebody went out of town for vacation or something.  Then I finally moved here and I still have about a 50-50 shot of actually getting food when I visit.  Either they are unexpectedly closed Or they are literally out of Shawarma.  Yesterday I tried to bring a friend here, Hoping them up about how great the food was and they were out of Shawarma.  Not only that, but the guy Acted like I was the A-hole for even wanting Shawarma that day.

I’ll still try to go back because the Shawarma is really banging But I’m gonna start calling ahead first just to make sure someone’s even there.  If I see an attempt at improvement by the business, I will amend my review.  Until then, For lack of availability and rude customer service this place gets one star.", "time": 1746751725, "translated": false}, {"author_name": "Yossi Zweig", "author_url": "https://www.google.com/maps/contrib/113276072176996902661/reviews", "language": "en", "original_language": "en", "profile_photo_url": "https://lh3.googleusercontent.com/a-/ALV-UjUdP1BQ6CbNyX1OkO4mBT0qB_wlXbmXX7TKAReVbPTrkIJNRP_rGw=s128-c0x00000000-cc-rp-mo-ba4", "rating": 5, "relative_time_description": "11 months ago", "text": "While vacationing in Florida this past week, I was told to check out the Friendship Grill in Fort Lauderdale, FL. You see unlike most upscale restaurants I visit, this one was very homey, with the authentic Israeli experience. You see the staff at the Friendship Grill are special needs children from Chabad’s Friendship Circle organization. These special children learn life skills, make friends, and are made to feel like they are a part of functioning society. It was for that reason that we drove out from Boyton Beach over 45min away. While the children only work there and in the Friendship Café next door from morning till 3pm, the place was full of pictures and information about the children. There was even a big screen with photos and captions as well as videos showing them off.  The man behind the grill and fryer, Tomer, a native Israeli, was telling us about how the kids help prep the food, stock the fridge and even take turns manning the cash register. Frankly, it was very inspiring. Tomer loaded our table up with the works. Plenty of piping hot pita bread, dips and salatim including; Carrot Salad, Beet Salad, Eggplant, Matbucha, Cole Slaw, and plenty of Chummus. Naturally we tried everything from the Falafel to the Shwarma and Schnitzel . We also got some delicious fries and sweet potato fries. Behind the restaurant is the Chabad House and Judacia Store. The food was really good and filling. The Falafel, crispy and golden brown on the outside and yummy, fragrant, and green on the inside. The turkey shwarma was juicy and soft, perfect when paired with some pita and chummus. For those that don’t want bread, they even had some rice and wrap sandwich. The schnitzel was really good. Crispy on the outside and buttery on the inside. Honestly, we couldn’t finish all the food. There was so much variety!  It’s a great place to eat and even better place to support. Visit Tomer and tell him Yossi sent you.", "time": 1724884345, "translated": false}, {"author_name": "Chuck Wharton", "author_url": "https://www.google.com/maps/contrib/111950164103849097959/reviews", "language": "en", "original_language": "en", "profile_photo_url": "https://lh3.googleusercontent.com/a-/ALV-UjVq5-on_v-QHmLeQsmIybXcOVKHstaD3ioFoJ6thWWfpe4HItXa=s128-c0x00000000-cc-rp-mo-ba4", "rating": 5, "relative_time_description": "5 months ago", "text": "Very good falafel wrap… quick, courteous service.  Highly recommended for lunch!", "time": 1740157817, "translated": false}]

The ambiance of the restaurant is vibrant and inviting, with tasteful decor and comfortable seating. The lighting and music created a lively yet relaxed atmosphere, making it perfect for both intimate dinners and group gatherings. ​

restaurants.google_reviews:
[{"author_name": "Bernadette Marie", "author_url": "https://www.google.com/maps/contrib/103219538994031213279/reviews", "language": "en", "original_language": "en", "profile_photo_url": "https://lh3.googleusercontent.com/a-/ALV-UjV8H3x0X_d85qEfH8qhQan6b6I3UPZOufa-zfsw84r8eB2h8Aw=s128-c0x00000000-cc-rp-mo", "rating": 5, "relative_time_description": "2 weeks ago", "text": "Tried this place… came back 4 days in a row
(and we’re still not sick of it!!) 😂❤️
Fresh, so comforting, and just hits the spot.
They’ve got dedicated Vegan and Gluten-Free mains and sides (yummy and amazing).
Thank you for taking such good care of us.", "time": 1752332447, "translated": false}, {"author_name": "Colaiv Freedman", "author_url": "https://www.google.com/maps/contrib/102825754110447914428/reviews", "language": "en", "original_language": "en", "profile_photo_url": "https://lh3.googleusercontent.com/a-/ALV-UjX_enNNCf45H-B0aJvbH7mxGqjKaic_lAabo5Mcp1moNLTILCvWig=s128-c0x00000000-cc-rp-mo-ba4", "rating": 5, "relative_time_description": "6 months ago", "text": "Grill Place is a fantastic new restaurant in East Boca. When news of their opening reached a group chat I’m in, the first response was, “Another Israeli grill joint?!”

While I have a soft spot for Israeli grill restaurants, Grill Place is much more than that.

I just enjoyed a delicious chicken salad for $16. The food felt incredibly fresh and light—none of that greasy feeling you sometimes get from fast-food places. There’s a certain homely feel to the food; it’s clear they put a lot of love and care into their dishes while keeping things simple.

The menu includes the classic Israeli grill options alongside hummus bowls, salads, and a soup of the day. They also offer a variety of “to-go” foods that were more eclectic than I expected. I noticed onion lokshin kugel (the sample I tried was fantastic), two kinds of meatballs, potato kugel, garlic confit, and two types of soups, among other options.

I appreciated their clear labeling of when each item was prepared. My pet peeve is buying prepared food without knowing how fresh it is, so this was a thoughtful and welcome touch. I imagine the variety in their “to-go” section expands even more as Shabbat approaches.

I’m also excited to hear that they plan to start offering lamb shawarma on certain days in the next couple of weeks, once their new gas line is installed (in addition to the baby chicken shawarma they currently have.)

Overall, Grill Place is a fresh, affordable, and exciting addition to the kosher dining scene in Boca. Wishing them great success!", "time": 1736976809, "translated": false}, {"author_name": "Avi Gewirtz", "author_url": "https://www.google.com/maps/contrib/117804441963042843534/reviews", "language": "en", "original_language": "en", "profile_photo_url": "https://lh3.googleusercontent.com/a/ACg8ocJ3VzGTjeoL8wChRvpmHN-StDg6K4Kvtf-HucC9u60PaDKkyQ=s128-c0x00000000-cc-rp-mo", "rating": 5, "relative_time_description": "2 months ago", "text": "Grill Place is wonderful! The food is delicious and tastes so fresh. Their platters are not only generous but beautifully presented. One standout item is their poppers—they’re incredibly flavorful and cooked to perfection. Whether you're stopping in for a quick bite or ordering a full spread, Grill Place delivers quality every time. Highly recommend!", "time": 1746670856, "translated": false}, {"author_name": "Victoria Tsilevych", "author_url": "https://www.google.com/maps/contrib/105366701862406352976/reviews", "language": "en", "original_language": "en", "profile_photo_url": "https://lh3.googleusercontent.com/a-/ALV-UjXNjLN9OyGcMgQM1nmvtNKRuFgFNnhaSNW6JWkPg_ai2NFoSx5H=s128-c0x00000000-cc-rp-mo-ba2", "rating": 5, "relative_time_description": "a week ago", "text": "⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️
Absolutely blown away by this new grill spot-the falafel was the freshest and best I’ve ever had. Perfectly crispy, full of flavor, and not the least bit greasy. But what really sealed the deal? The pita and hummus. The pita was pillowy and warm, and the hummus was so creamy and rich it could be the star of the menu on its own. This place is a standout- no frills, just incredibly good food. Highly recommend to anyone who appreciates real, authentic flavor.", "time": 1752609990, "translated": false}, {"author_name": "Bryan", "author_url": "https://www.google.com/maps/contrib/106815254099525109880/reviews", "language": "en", "original_language": "en", "profile_photo_url": "https://lh3.googleusercontent.com/a/ACg8ocKDGuAYifu5G_MqkwjolAv6DjG4E5edgNK-898_tUs8OIUtFw=s128-c0x00000000-cc-rp-mo", "rating": 5, "relative_time_description": "2 months ago", "text": "Grill Place is an amazing, clean, family-run restaurant with convenient take-home options. They have great lunch specials at fantastic prices, as well as package specials that include large portions for families, and item varieties that would accommodate even the pickiest of eaters. I can't say enough good things about Grill Place or recommend it enough to anyone in the area--or even out of the area. They are worth the trip!", "time": 1748198597, "translated": false}]

[{"author_name": "Reuven Herssein", "author_url": "https://www.google.com/maps/contrib/110911748439784127152/reviews", "language": "en", "original_language": "en", "profile_photo_url": "https://lh3.googleusercontent.com/a-/ALV-UjUcXj3ubOcY-eQqNzVusXnz4mwApb9bYjStHXLNh3rGFf31tzmt=s128-c0x00000000-cc-rp-mo-ba4", "rating": 5, "relative_time_description": "a month ago", "text": "From the moment you enter Hikari, a Kosher Japanese establishment in Surfside FL, the friendly and inviting staff, beautiful interior design, pumping music all make the vibe of this place really great.  We had two of the experiences on the menu, (photo) twilight and the Hikari Experience.  The Fish was fresh and all the dishes were tasty and delicious. They are only in the second week of being open so our experience was impressive. Great drinks. We opted for straight top shelf Tequila.  We found out after they have Saki.... next time.   Definitely will be coming back soon. Awesome. 5 stars.", "time": 1749151277, "translated": false}, {"author_name": "levi schneider", "author_url": "https://www.google.com/maps/contrib/104515639458861434043/reviews", "language": "en", "original_language": "en", "profile_photo_url": "https://lh3.googleusercontent.com/a-/ALV-UjUk-lAk3UqlOXBxt-FirialNYwUFdKx79CFbJ6cn2KgwSMqH6gH=s128-c0x00000000-cc-rp-mo", "rating": 5, "relative_time_description": "a month ago", "text": "Awesome experience ate there last night, food was  fantastic  all the sushi was top notch, ordered the waghu steak and lamb chops as well which were  incredible.. The atmosphere A+, the place is super comfortable to sit in, beautiful vibe ,   place was busy and the service was great. will definitely be back!", "time": 1749679150, "translated": false}, {"author_name": "David Elharar", "author_url": "https://www.google.com/maps/contrib/109256906319067070376/reviews", "language": "en", "original_language": "en", "profile_photo_url": "https://lh3.googleusercontent.com/a-/ALV-UjWk5O-MGOk-9OpGMj1ERWTBtDGG9sV3yxJMLEzGR7laDNeNT2pk=s128-c0x00000000-cc-rp-mo-ba4", "rating": 5, "relative_time_description": "2 months ago", "text": "Wow wow wow!!!
Yes, give me more.
Finally the place that we all have been waiting for.
This has to be a Micheline star restaurant... And KOSHER!
The combination of amazing food, freshness, colors coupled with second to none service, I just can't believe I'm in a kosher restaurant!
Sushi is a must, and anything with fresh fish just trust me and try it, you can thank me later.
AND the decor!?!? Wow, how is it possible that a kosher place looks like this!
This is the only full 5 star restaurant I ever reviewed, and the only one that really deserves it so far.
Try the alcohol drinks, so worth it!
Come here for a business meeting, night out with friends or partner, or for a first date!
Reserve a place and plan a head, this place will play with a bunch of your senses, a total experience!

BTW, something incredible here is that it might be open for shabbos, but regardless it makes great shabbos food.", "time": 1747425898, "translated": false}, {"author_name": "Shmuel Chaikin", "author_url": "https://www.google.com/maps/contrib/111224125411213279931/reviews", "language": "en", "original_language": "en", "profile_photo_url": "https://lh3.googleusercontent.com/a/ACg8ocIJlstAv-qXFoeD3n-sBgNcsqlUdqxdWHEL71FzDoLhcwZG9Q=s128-c0x00000000-cc-rp-mo-ba5", "rating": 5, "relative_time_description": "a month ago", "text": "Dining at Hikari was a complete sensory experience — not just a meal, but an immersion into beauty, flavor, and intentional design.

The moment we stepped in, we were struck by the elegance of the space. The ceiling is a sculptural cloud — soft, organic, otherworldly — and the booth we were seated in offered the perfect balance of intimacy and sophistication. You truly feel tucked away in your own little world, yet surrounded by quiet energy and luxury.

Our server was warm and gracious, and the hospitality throughout the evening matched the finesse of the food. We began with the bluefin crispy rice — not my usual pick (I’m watching what I eat), but my wife insisted, and she couldn’t have been more right. The plating was stunning: precise, vibrant, and confident. The crispy base gave just the right crunch, and the bluefin on top was buttery, clean, and impossibly fresh. Topped with avocado, kosho aioli, and a slice of serrano, it was the kind of bite that makes you pause and smile.

Each course that followed kept building on that high. The salmon sashimi came out on a glass plate so elegant it felt like it belonged in a gallery. Just one slice, a touch of wasabi, and fresh greens — minimalism at its most refined. Every detail was curated, from the delicate layering of the garnishes to the quality of the fish itself.

We also ordered the rice bowl with the fried egg — hearty yet still elevated, with umami-packed rice and a beautiful yolk resting like a crown on top. The flavor was bold and comforting, balanced by the sleek presentation.

What really stood out was how carefully each dish was plated. Nothing was rushed, nothing looked thrown together. It felt like the kitchen was telling a story — restrained where it needed to be, daring when it mattered. The glassware, the menu design, even the chopsticks — all part of the same elevated experience.

We sipped on cocktails served in chilled, elegant glasses (with edible flowers!), which added a romantic touch to the evening. Even our sparkling water and soda felt thoughtfully presented.

Hikari isn’t just about kosher food done well — it’s kosher dining completely reimagined. Sophisticated, confident, and worthy of a night out, this is a restaurant that raises the bar in every category. We left glowing  and already planning when to return.", "time": 1750647403, "translated": false}, {"author_name": "hanna hijuelos", "author_url": "https://www.google.com/maps/contrib/115485377471122083975/reviews", "language": "en", "original_language": "en", "profile_photo_url": "https://lh3.googleusercontent.com/a-/ALV-UjXtMD7JaJSaZEACRQFDQofdkmW2KfiYXBsbd1npXN5Jv9As7NXf=s128-c0x00000000-cc-rp-mo", "rating": 5, "relative_time_description": "2 months ago", "text": "The food, the ambiance, the service, all 10/10. We had an exceptional experience. Thank you Christian for such a lovely time! He was an amazing waiter!", "time": 1747957844, "translated": false}]

The new owner has transformed the space, the menu, and the quality, and I can honestly say that they serve the best kosher pizza in South Florida. Sumptuous thin crust with just the right amount of crunch combined with the highest quality kosher mozzarella cheese that made my tastebuds explode with flavor (I love pizza!).

I was curious about the rest of the menu and the other patrons raved about the appetizers, homemade soups, and pastas.

Hollywood Sar's gets my highest recommendation.", "time": 1736269557, "translated": false}]
restaurants.name: Hollywood Sara's Pizza
restaurants.short_description: Varied kosher menu includes pizza, Chinese, vegan & Mexican fare in a no-frills space. Rated 4.3/5 stars on Google. Budget-friendly pricing. Specializes in Restaurant.

restaurants.google_reviews:
[{"author_name": "Brian S", "author_url": "https://www.google.com/maps/contrib/110456156403734843508/reviews", "language": "en", "original_language": "en", "profile_photo_url": "https://lh3.googleusercontent.com/a-/ALV-UjUtEKNKJnUy1Rc54TlsvrO0NTWpCYB9uWH6Pk41LHW6umeSiDxt=s128-c0x00000000-cc-rp-mo-ba5", "rating": 5, "relative_time_description": "a month ago", "text": "First time today... found on google and decided let's take a trip!

Service was excellent. Grill was down but offered to build a brisket sandwich on a bun with the cheese sauce. Threw in a rib to try as we debated between it and Brisket. Rib was fire!

3 Meats, got Brisket, Beef Sausage and Chicken quarters. All 9+ on the scale.

Sides were Mac n Cheese, Baked beans and Green Beans. Mac was different with the cheese sauce, and different meaning in a GOOD way.

Outdoor seating only, but big shade trees to be under. We will be back... phenomenal.

Great work yal!", "time": 1751133396, "translated": false}, {"author_name": "Shirley Davis", "author_url": "https://www.google.com/maps/contrib/102226196432553462448/reviews", "language": "en", "original_language": "en", "profile_photo_url": "https://lh3.googleusercontent.com/a/ACg8ocILrVH8XeJLvajeEgoGNVT1Dnv-YzGNrfDtaXWZPBIw-9NX1A=s128-c0x00000000-cc-rp-mo", "rating": 5, "relative_time_description": "4 months ago", "text": "I really enjoyed the sides at this establishment. The smoky Mac and cheese was really good. It was a flavor I’ve never tasted before in mac and cheese. It actually tasted smoky. The cornbread casserole was very good. The loaded potatoes reminded me of twice baked mash potatoes. My family and I had a peanut butter pie and a coconut cream pie. They both were tasty, piled high with whipped cream, and cold. I liked that they were cold. The atmosphere was warm with picnic tables and the classic red and white squares. There is no indoor seating, just outdoor. Parking is limited. And they serve food until close or sell out. We enjoyed speaking to Troy. He was very kind, he believes in the taste of the food that he sells, and you can tell that he cares.", "time": 1741540427, "translated": false}, {"author_name": "Alaa Daghash", "author_url": "https://www.google.com/maps/contrib/101606966125592008738/reviews", "language": "en", "original_language": "en", "profile_photo_url": "https://lh3.googleusercontent.com/a/ACg8ocJTCmgdulUBtLQsN88d724j6-0OKZl96B_Kvf6XPah-xAON3w=s128-c0x00000000-cc-rp-mo-ba2", "rating": 5, "relative_time_description": "3 months ago", "text": "My sister recommended this place to me. She told me to get the Mac and cheese bowl and I did. Best decision ever. You’re telling me I got 32 ounces of Mac and cheese with the most tender brisket and 3 extra tasty sides for $12…yeah I never admit she’s right but with this one I HAD to. I have food for days. The other sides looked awesome, It took me forever to decide which 3  to get today. But I can’t wait to try the rest of the menu items when I go back . Very kind workers and speedy service ! Loved it all :)", "time": 1745620678, "translated": false}, {"author_name": "Javier Salazar", "author_url": "https://www.google.com/maps/contrib/100827982627989948957/reviews", "language": "en", "original_language": "en", "profile_photo_url": "https://lh3.googleusercontent.com/a-/ALV-UjXC_rDLuZGyfsCPX6SgaSqp2nA6nTfO3JwgELSadvYnpFJzYhqDpQ=s128-c0x00000000-cc-rp-mo-ba4", "rating": 5, "relative_time_description": "7 months ago", "text": "After a long day of trail walking our group was craving something delicious and comforting at the same time and we definitely found both at Briskets BBQ Shack and Grill.

We were greeted by genuine smiles and friendly “hello’s”. From the appetizing menu at the entrance to the wonderful BBQ aroma inside, we couldn’t wait to try the mouth-watering food items.

I had the brisket with the absolutely delicious cornbread. Others in my group had the BBQ ribs with the delicious country beans and the pulled pork with the smoked mac and cheese.

The brisket was perfectly seasoned and well cooked and the ribs were juicy and very tender. The beans are original in style and flavor, very well made. My only critique is the smoked mac and cheese; while well made and delicious, it lacked the smoky flavor
I was expecting. Overall however, the food and service both are worthy of five stars and will definitely be back to try other menu items the next time I am in Orlando.

Excellent job!!", "time": 1735339584, "translated": false}, {"author_name": "Spencer Davis", "author_url": "https://www.google.com/maps/contrib/102311711102510020698/reviews", "language": "en", "original_language": "en", "profile_photo_url": "https://lh3.googleusercontent.com/a/ACg8ocLGGUQe1HJBg79SiBa2ePeifSlCnMMt9sumMNSN-mVHVdQ44A=s128-c0x00000000-cc-rp-mo-ba2", "rating": 5, "relative_time_description": "4 months ago", "text": "I had the opportunity to meet one of the chefs here at another business. He mentioned that he made some of the best brisket in Orlando. Naturally, I had to test his theory for truthfulness. I can say that I was not disappointed!

We tried the Brisket, Burnt Ends, Macaroni, Loaded Potatoes, Fire Roasted Corn, and Corn Bread Casserole. Also, we went back for Peanut Butter Pie and Coconut Cream Pie. Are you getting the picture?

I honestly can't remember the last time I ate somewhere and was pleased to overjoyed with literally everything I tasted. The burnt ends fell apart on my fork, the macaroni was smokey, the brisket was on point... this place is so good!

Huge shout out to Troy and the team for providing a warm environment and delicious food. Don't change a thing. We'll be back, and in the meantime we'll send our friends and family!", "time": 1741386637, "translated": false}]

I can’t even describe it so look at the photos.", "time": 1740072357, "translated": false}, {"author_name": "Frank Garcia", "author_url": "https://www.google.com/maps/contrib/108125164798293750787/reviews", "language": "en", "original_language": "en", "profile_photo_url": "https://lh3.googleusercontent.com/a-/ALV-UjXGfePFisYnRD9-OlgVxHYB8S-f4wfcSxsTanwqaHxnyEv3-O1T=s128-c0x00000000-cc-rp-mo-ba6", "rating": 3, "relative_time_description": "a month ago", "text": "I had high expectations for Madame Olivia but it didn’t do it for me.

I had their sunny breakfast which consists of a small salad, bacon,  fried eggs and bread. It was alright nothing it would blow your mind. The bread arrived after I had already finished. Although, the bacon was pretty good, that was my favorite part of that dish.

The shakshuka, a simple dish, nothing complicated, was not good at all.  It was watery and lacking spices. I make better shakshuka at home.

The coffee was 3 out of 5. It was weak and the coffee and milk were kind of separated. This is not how it is supposed to be. And $6.50 for a flat white and/or a latte is excessive, specially when quality is not there.

I wanted to try their cheesecake, it looked good but after my experience with the food and coffee and didn’t want to gamble on it.

And the food… wow. Every dish was packed with flavor, like those bites that make you close your eyes and just feel it. Beautifully plated, super creative combos, and you can tell there’s real passion and talent in that kitchen.

The service? Spot on. Friendly, helpful, and they really knew the menu.

If you’re in Miami and want a unique, delicious, and vibey dining experience—Madame Olivia is the place. restaurants.google_reviews:
[{"author_name": "Eleanor Hoh", "author_url": "https://www.google.com/maps/contrib/103265200061665184255/reviews", "language": "en", "original_language": "en", "profile_photo_url": "https://lh3.googleusercontent.com/a-/ALV-UjX2HGtig1PovVyNYiosasomcLd2B3VB-T9auLC9xKm1WqkbBas=s128-c0x00000000-cc-rp-mo-ba3", "rating": 1, "relative_time_description": "a month ago", "text": "I’ve been visiting all Asian restaurants in North Beach/Aventura area to post a blog and give people a list where to eat and shop! I’d heard about this restaurant but resisted going cause I suspected from menu it would be more American Chinese!

When I entered, it’s clean and renovated cause I noticed upgraded decor from older photos. The back area where I was directed to sit, the furniture was too big in the middle isle and we had to squeeze past elbows.

My friend and I both ordered Lunch Special. The minute the Hot & Sour Soup came out, I could tell it was full of cornstarch. The texture was slimy and not pleasant. I order this soup as a benchmark to check if the quality of food will be good. Hit it right on the head. Bad start.

The server thought I said Sesame Beef but I ordered Sichuan Beef. I didn’t return it because I didn’t want my friend to eat on her own or wait for me.

The Sesame beef was covered in batter and topped with a thick, sweet sauce! The beef itself wasn’t bad but the goopy sauce had probably MSG AND high sugar (which many Chinese restaurants tend to use) was the kind that sent me to sleep in my car before I could finish my food shopping!

The pork fried rice was very dry and tasteless! How can you go wrong with fried rice? Come on.

I would return to try dumplings and main dishes BUT if they can’t get simple dishes right, why would I spend more money there?", "time": 1749656580, "translated": false}, {"author_name": "The SoFlo Duo", "author_url": "https://www.google.com/maps/contrib/109047240490609465780/reviews", "language": "en", "original_language": "en", "profile_photo_url": "https://lh3.googleusercontent.com/a-/ALV-UjUFBaVn8oHBrE8AEJ-EZOALVItUY5PyUh-eAafVtNEqvg-xXyQ=s128-c0x00000000-cc-rp-mo-ba5", "rating": 5, "relative_time_description": "a month ago", "text": "Mr Chef’s is a solid spot for dine in or takeout Chinese food in Aventura. The food came out hot, fresh, and full of flavor—especially the Mongolian beef and their specialty handmade dumplings. Their Peking Duck is delicious and we love the wraps they use. It’s a casual place, but the service was fast and very attentive. The menu has a good mix of favorites and popular classics. Highly recommend and would definitely return!

Instagram - @thesofloduo", "time": 1748831918, "translated": false}, {"author_name": "M. H.", "author_url": "https://www.google.com/maps/contrib/116155962191202103039/reviews", "language": "en", "original_language": "en", "profile_photo_url": "https://lh3.googleusercontent.com/a-/ALV-UjVGyYzsmD3uXQOrnZKcP0-y3aka2kN9dBmzQOK1S-lba6gNajY=s128-c0x00000000-cc-rp-mo-ba6", "rating": 4, "relative_time_description": "6 months ago", "text": "Nice Chinese alternative for dining in or taking out any day of the week. There were no high chairs available, and we didn’t bring shoes because we expected to be in and out, not sitting there for 45 minutes with no food. [{"author_name": "Ari Eliefja", "author_url": "https://www.google.com/maps/contrib/105957111314159364754/reviews", "language": "en", "original_language": "en", "profile_photo_url": "https://lh3.googleusercontent.com/a/ACg8ocK1TP0obN0_K8f3pFzdYf6jflFG597YJco5lR1bGCM-CzDEhA=s128-c0x00000000-cc-rp-mo-ba6", "rating": 3, "relative_time_description": "2 years ago", "text": "We enjoyed the pea soup and thin crust pizza. They also list kinish but it was news to them and they had none. Ended up with a falafel pita, it was cheap, the falafels and pita were good, but there was little else to it besides some very bland strips of Romain and a few flavorless cubes of tomato and cucumber. Bathroom clearly hasn’t been cleaned in a long time, tables and chairs were extremely grimy. Shocked they have a kosher certificate with the lack of cleanliness. Maybe the pizza is ok, I didn’t have any, can’t imagine how they would still be open if it isn’t.", "time": 1746145870, "translated": false}, {"author_name": "oriya klein", "author_url": "https://www.google.com/maps/contrib/102219020891839308241/reviews", "language": "en", "original_language": "en", "profile_photo_url": "https://lh3.googleusercontent.com/a-/ALV-UjVRhMZTNbZFa_XYU5V_YMfkn3L3rx5GGiMS-tW8gACcrmnKso8=s128-c0x00000000-cc-rp-mo-ba5", "rating": 4, "relative_time_description": "6 years ago", "text": "2nd edit:
After speaking with John, the owner, it’s was confirmed that the employee who answers the phone made a mistake and miscalculated the wait time. John straightened everything out and I am sure will work on his customer experience.
Still waited over 45 minutes in line.

Edit:
Was here at the exit of Passover. The place is packed and even though I ordered an hour and a half ago, was told it will be ready in 45 min to an hour, when I get there I need to wait for another almost an hour just to get my order. They take advantage of being the only game in town and they can get away with it. they are giving at 1st come 1st serve basis even though everyone ordered. Great pizza is not enough. You need some customer service too. see pics below.

Dear John: if you don’t make some serious changes you your customer service there will be other players that will take your marketshare. It’s just how this works.

——————————————————
My initial review:

Great place to come with your family and get some fresh pizza! Great service.", "time": 1556422062, "translated": false}, {"author_name": "Elior Nagar", "author_url": "https://www.google.com/maps/contrib/103008612693344518786/reviews", "language": "en", "original_language": "en", "profile_photo_url": "https://lh3.googleusercontent.com/a-/ALV-UjWK0lhrojN-AotEh0npzxcYHgeRxyhehZ0k5-UBecYz4VNKqVg=s128-c0x00000000-cc-rp-mo", "rating": 1, "relative_time_description": "3 years ago", "text": "I was on this place few times it’s nice Jewish oner with grate service lest time I ordered 2 pizza slices special that should cost not more then $7-8 but the lady on the front charged me $13.32 for 3 I told her that I ordered only 2 but she didn’t want to give me my money back even that I toke only 2 slices… it’s not Regarding the money it’s regarding the service and that she lying to me in my face…. And the pizza was cold not ready for eating I am usually not writing reviews so I feeling bad for the oner but I drive 15 minutes to eat a good pizza he’ll not going to see me again in this place", "time": 1647887511, "translated": false}, {"author_name": "Doug L", "author_url": "https://www.google.com/maps/contrib/111030620724291402977/reviews", "language": "en", "original_language": "en", "profile_photo_url": "https://lh3.googleusercontent.com/a-/ALV-UjWa-U7ToTyzbgD2dv9bC-iOqI57b4njnT2xr1l_UROYHliU5yxW=s128-c0x00000000-cc-rp-mo", "rating": 1, "relative_time_description": "a year ago", "text": "My city has no kosher restaurants. So, I like to frequent several of them while here. I went to Jon's Place and got a few items. The fish & chips and a slice of pizza. The minestrone soup was good as was the pizza. However, the fish & chips were another story. After 1 bite, I can say it was probably the worst I have ever had. I complained and asked what kind of fish. They said it was cod. I explained that I was from Canada & it absolutely wasn't cod. So, they said it was tilapia. I think it was Pollack and probably freezer burned and I said I would not eat such a horrible meal. They gave me a look, so! I told them I would like to get something else, which they were very put off by. Reluctantly, they asked what I wanted. I told them, Eggplant Parmesan. They rang it up and said I needed to pay the difference. I pointed to their menu board & showed it was the same price. The cashier day manager said their computer showed it at $4 more and that's what I needed to pay. I told them to just forget it and gave them their horrible paid-for meal back. What atrocious service.", "time": 1718761681, "translated": false}]

I was pleasantly surprised at the ample seating both indoor and out, with a cool and modern decor. We were seated immediately and started browsing the menu. We only had two hours till we had to leave so we decided to go light. Since we landed earlier in the day we started with a Caesar salad, the Chili Mix, Crispy Cauliflower and the Angus Beef Skewers. The food came quickly and we dived right in. Firstly, the Cauliflower was nice and crunchy and crispy, unlike the ones I tasted elsewhere. It was a pleasant surprise. They also had a little kick. The salad was fresh with a delicious dressing. The Chili Mix however, yummmmmm. My wife was skeptical when I ordered it, but after only one bite she was hooked. The chili which consisted of ground beef and black beans, cooked with chipotle peppers and served with Nacho Chips, \u201csour cream\u201d (vegan of course) and pico de gallo. I couldn\u2019t stop eating it. Now lets talk about the Angus Beef Skewers. Wow! Soft flavorful meat on a skewer with some onions and peppers. The meat was so tender and juicy, I honestly could\u2019ve ended the meal here. Naturally, I wanted to try just one entr\u00e9e. I went with the Ribeye steak medium rare, which was grilled to perfection. It was soft and flavorful. The Ribeye also came with a side of fries. I also ordered one drink as I was on vacation, I ordered the Golden Margarita. It was the perfect way to end the night. Here is my summary. Great service, really good food, and VERY well priced. The whole meal with tax was just over $200. In the NY/NJ area, a meal like this would be at least double the price. We were also out within an hour and a half of just walking in. They make the best corned beef sandwich I have ever eaten .
The food costs a lot. They do have one of the best tasting hamburgers anywhere.
Beware, you cannot avoid paying 3.00 or more if you ask for water on the table.", "time": 1751301841, "translated": false}, {"author_name": "Colaiv Freedman", "author_url": "https://www.google.com/maps/contrib/102825754110447914428/reviews", "language": "en", "original_language": "en", "profile_photo_url": "https://lh3.googleusercontent.com/a-/ALV-UjX_enNNCf45H-B0aJvbH7mxGqjKaic_lAabo5Mcp1moNLTILCvWig=s128-c0x00000000-cc-rp-mo-ba4", "rating": 3, "relative_time_description": "4 months ago", "text": "Food was excellent and delicious, far surpassed expectations.

I ordered the vegetable curry. It was tiny, not worth the price. The owners should take this into consideration. This is constructive consideration. It was delicious but more like a tiny appetizer, not an entree. My friend ordered shawarma, I think. I didn't taste it, but it did not look like shawarma to me, and I've been eating shawarma since '81 at Shemesh on Jabotinsky in Ramat Gan. The best. What they brought to the table at Kosher Chobee was not shawarma, if you ask me.

Second visit I ordered their salmon. Excellent, delicious. Tiny. If ordering a same priced entree from Bambu, the size is double, just to compare. Kinda ruined the mood. Not int'd in hearing such things while eating out.", "time": 1752267896, "translated": false}]

[{"author_name": "mio miselfo", "author_url": "https://www.google.com/maps/contrib/107524891110124527874/reviews", "language": "en", "original_language": "en", "profile_photo_url": "https://lh3.googleusercontent.com/a-/ALV-UjWC5KR-1ldS2DXjfJMmMFnrw_QCjokwVEkJEQYpXfuLObizCc8=s128-c0x00000000-cc-rp-mo-ba6", "rating": 5, "relative_time_description": "a year ago", "text": "Tucked away in the vibrant culinary scene of Miami, The Grill House Kosher Restaurant stands out as a true gem for those seeking exquisite kosher cuisine. From the moment you step inside, you're greeted with an ambiance that exudes warmth and sophistication, setting the stage for an unforgettable dining experience.

Upon my recent visit to The Grill House, I was fortunate to experience the exceptional service provided by Miriam, a shining star among the restaurant's staff. From the moment I was seated, Miriam's attentiveness and professionalism were evident, as she seamlessly guided me through the menu and ensured that every aspect of my dining experience was nothing short of perfect.

Now, let's talk about the food. The Grill House boasts a menu that showcases a tantalizing array of kosher delicacies, each crafted with precision and care. From succulent steaks to fresh salad and everything in between, there's something to satisfy every palate. I had the pleasure of indulging in their signature grilled ribeye steak, cooked to juicy perfection and bursting with flavor. Each bite was a testament to the culinary expertise of the chefs behind the scenes.

What truly impressed me about The Grill House, aside from the delectable cuisine, was the attention to detail and dedication to excellence that permeated every aspect of the dining experience. From the elegant presentation of each dish to the seamless coordination of service, it was evident that the entire team takes immense pride in their craft.

As I savored my meal, I couldn't help but appreciate the inviting ambiance of the restaurant. The chic yet comfortable decor creates an atmosphere that is both sophisticated and welcoming, making it the perfect setting for a memorable dining experience with family and friends.

In conclusion, my visit to The Grill House Kosher Restaurant was nothing short of extraordinary. The combination of impeccable service from Miriam and the culinary delights served up by the talented kitchen team made for an unforgettable dining experience. If you're in search of a kosher restaurant in Miami that delivers on both quality and service, look no further than The Grill House. Trust me, you won't be disappointed.", "time": 1710515170, "translated": false}, {"author_name": "Akiva Gottlieb", "author_url": "https://www.google.com/maps/contrib/101268997002934768876/reviews", "language": "en", "original_language": "en", "profile_photo_url": "https://lh3.googleusercontent.com/a/ACg8ocIaub6b2iU8Wu2ObXPqkXKJM5A6zjRxlg7qXFkLtcSvejtuZg=s128-c0x00000000-cc-rp-mo-ba3", "rating": 5, "relative_time_description": "2 years ago", "text": "Food was well flavored and well cooked, and the service was great. My most recent visit was during Yeshiva week 2019 and as you can imagine they are swamped. Surprisingly however, the service seemed to be up to the challenge and performed adequately.

For our staters there were the Pitot and basic assortment of salads, followed by some classic Israeli appetizers. We then ordered all the steaks on the menu including the cowboy steak from the chefs menu.

All in all great time at this classic steakhouse with a little Israeli flavor.", "time": 1548607341, "translated": false}]

The classic glazed donut was just as amazing as we remembered—warm, soft, and perfectly sweet. The Boston Kreme was rich and smooth with a good balance between the custard filling and chocolate topping. The Kreme-filled donut was equally indulgent, with a generous amount of filling and a soft, fresh texture.

The location itself was clean, and the restrooms were impressively well-kept—definitely a plus when you're on the road. It's a great little stop to grab a treat and take a quick break.

However, a couple of things could have been better. First, the service was a bit lacking. The server wasn’t rude, but they were far from welcoming—no smile, no real engagement. Just seemed uninterested. Also, it's worth noting this location is not pet friendly, so keep that in mind if you're traveling with a furry companion.

I wish I could give zero stars...", "time": 1753031036, "translated": false}, {"author_name": "Bucky", "author_url": "https://www.google.com/maps/contrib/109084597523497981033/reviews", "language": "en", "original_language": "en", "profile_photo_url": "https://lh3.googleusercontent.com/a-/ALV-UjVOcvhGQ_by5fgaAYWgpWA1mI3F8ODz-swUpfs-DbZ8iId1vJMx=s128-c0x00000000-cc-rp-mo-ba6", "rating": 5, "relative_time_description": "a year ago", "text": "I recently visited a Krispy Kreme, and it was an outstanding experience! The highlight was definitely the original glazed donuts, especially when they are hot and freshly made. You can tell they are fresh when the “hot now” sign lights up outside – a true beacon for donut lovers. 🔥

I tried a variety of donuts, and while they were all delicious, nothing compares to the classic original glazed. The drive-thru can get a bit packed when the donuts are freshly made, but the line moves smoothly thanks to the efficient and friendly staff. Kudos to the team for keeping up with the high demand!

One of the best parts of the visit was being able to see the donuts being made on the assembly line. The entire area was clean and well-organized, which added to the overall positive experience. I highly recommend stopping by for a warm, melt-in-your-mouth donut treat. Great job, Krispy Kreme! 👏", "time": 1720973191, "translated": false}, {"author_name": "Gabriel Ramos", "author_url": "https://www.google.com/maps/contrib/117166210188849792613/reviews", "language": "en", "original_language": "en", "profile_photo_url": "https://lh3.googleusercontent.com/a-/ALV-UjXvvRp6CJOaoFA2Zjjc7nzEZis9oE8U5UtrVrpoh1xzC6tn0tg=s128-c0x00000000-cc-rp-mo-ba3", "rating": 5, "relative_time_description": "5 months ago", "text": "Although at first I had a bad experience, it is worth highlighting the work of Krispy Kreme’s team to solve the inconvenience, so I give them a 100. I’ll definitely be back", "time": 1740179235, "translated": false}, {"author_name": "Jillian Celeste", "author_url": "https://www.google.com/maps/contrib/101074038939159256802/reviews", "language": "en", "original_language": "en", "profile_photo_url": "https://lh3.googleusercontent.com/a/ACg8ocJhqeN0xTB2berugSoQwSPCnJoSTZlSd1_3c35-N4dYFdRzJQ=s128-c0x00000000-cc-rp-mo", "rating": 5, "relative_time_description": "10 months ago", "text": "The shop was huge, there were tables around so if you decided to enjoy a donut there you could watch the fresh donuts being made.

Service only got 2 stars though due to the order being incomplete. We placed an online order through the app and saw we had an option to get a free donut with our purchase. We bought a dozen and picked a free donut but did not receive it, we thought it would have been added in with the dozen but it wasn't. I am writing this review to bring to light a deeply troubling experience at the Krispy Kreme location at 1240 West Hillsborough Blvd., Deerfield Beach, FL, on June 30th, 2025, at approximately 4:57 PM. As a loyal customer, I am appalled by the behavior of one of your staff members, Kurteria, and the overall lack of professionalism displayed at this location.

What happened:

Upon arriving at the drive-thru, I was in the process of deciding my order when Kurteria approached my window and asked if she could help. I informed her I was still figuring out what to order. Instead of courteous assistance, she rudely snapped, "Hurry up, I don’t have all day," stating she was about to go on her break. I heard another coworker laughing in the background, which only added to the uncomfortable and unprofessional atmosphere.

I was stunned by her disrespectful tone and shared my shock with my friends, who confirmed they heard her rude comment. Kurteria then repeated her dismissive remark even as I drove off. As I parked my vehicle and approached the entrance, I saw her inside the establishment at the front door, seemingly preparing to leave, with her keys in hand and her body language indicating she was about to go on break.

When I asked to speak to the manager, Kurteria falsely claimed she was the manager. She then followed me to the counter, despite claiming to be on break, and proceeded to serve me. I paid for the donuts, which, unfortunately, were completely unacceptable—dry, overcooked, darker than usual, and inedible. My friends and I had to throw the donuts away due to their poor quality.

This experience is unacceptable on every level:

Unprofessional and rude behavior:** Kurteria’s attitude and language towards a customer are completely inappropriate and uncalled for. This kind of conduct tarnishes the reputation of Krispy Kreme and discourages loyal customers.

Lack of proper management oversight:** The fact that such behavior went unchecked suggests a serious management failure. Her claim to be the manager, despite her rude behavior, is concerning.

Subpar product quality:** The donuts were overcooked and dry, which indicates a lack of attention to quality control.

My call to action:

I have already contacted corporate, and they assured me they would investigate. I declined their offer of a replacement dozen donuts, as my primary concern is the conduct of your staff and the overall customer experience at this location.

To Krispy Kreme Corporate:
This incident raises serious questions about staff training, management oversight, and customer service standards at this location. I urge you to take immediate action—conduct a thorough investigation, provide additional staff training, and ensure that your employees uphold the professionalism and quality standards that Krispy Kreme is known for.

Customers deserve respectful service and consistent product quality. Anything less damages your brand’s reputation and discourages repeat business.

In conclusion:
This was a highly disappointing experience that I hope prompts swift action from your corporate team. My hubs has been here multiple times when he grabs challah for Shabbat at Sarah’s Tent nearby but it was actually my first time. Have to say I enjoyed the plate I got. I opted for a shwarma plate since its less messy than getting a pita with all the ingredients inside. The items I put on my plate: Israeli salad, onions marinated with Sumac, pickles, tabouleh, hickory fries and of course chicken shwarma. Loooved the combination of all the food on the plate. Especially the onions with sumac. This really hit the spot. It was so juicy and flavorful and complemented the rest of the items on my plate so well. Their pita was also soft and fluffy and I loved the hint of char in the middle on it. It really added to the taste. Only thing I would say as a comment is that the chicken was more on the drier end. I definitely will keep coming back. This is a great, healthy kosher option in the area !", "time": 1681502854, "translated": false}]

restaurants.google_reviews:
[{"author_name": "Ciera", "author_url": "https://www.google.com/maps/contrib/103104904674317432497/reviews", "language": "en", "original_language": "en", "profile_photo_url": "https://lh3.googleusercontent.com/a/ACg8ocI1h3oqGqrdTf-_dGEs_dyA5Qn0IbXaECPNg3k0gdr8lUPziw=s128-c0x00000000-cc-rp-mo-ba3", "rating": 3, "relative_time_description": "2 weeks ago", "text": "Review: Would Not Return

DO NOT get the Caesar salad it was a crime against all Caesar salads. Tasted like nothing. My tongue was betrayed. Honestly, a 0/10. Absolutely inedible.

Caprese Salad – 2.3/5
Also not good. The cheese didn’t taste like it usually does in a salad like that definitely not fresh or creamy. It threw the whole thing off. Really disappointing for something that’s supposed to be simple and delicious.

Fries – 3/5
They were decent, nothing special.

Fish & Chips – 3/5
Underwhelming. The fish wasn’t bad, but it wasn’t memorable either. Just okay.

Burekas – 3/5
Totally average. Nothing stood out. Felt more like a filler item than something worth ordering.

Pasta – 5/5
This was the only highlight. It was actually good, but not good enough to make up for the rest of the meal especially that Caesar salad disaster.

Service was standard, nothing to complain about but nothing that stood out either. The place was empty, and the ambiance matched that energy just plain and boring. Nothing about the space felt warm, interesting, or memorable.

restaurants.google_reviews:
[{"author_name": "Adi Asher", "author_url": "https://www.google.com/maps/contrib/104593730149322837586/reviews", "language": "en", "original_language": "en", "profile_photo_url": "https://lh3.googleusercontent.com/a/ACg8ocJB8XfDN88KDOTu6IooG_HUByb1jGZWKSt7S00My6irg84Ghg=s128-c0x00000000-cc-rp-mo-ba3", "rating": 5, "relative_time_description": "a week ago", "text": "An unforgettable experience! The moment we walked into the restaurant, we were impressed by the beautiful design and warm atmosphere. The service was outstanding, friendly, professional, and genuinely passionate about the food. The staff gave us excellent recommendations, and every dish was a burst of authentic Israeli flavors that truly sparked in our mouths. Everything was fresh, flavorful, and beautifully plated. We had such a great time and left already planning our next visit. Highly, highly recommended!", "time": 1752765643, "translated": false}, {"author_name": "Rafael Mahgerefteh", "author_url": "https://www.google.com/maps/contrib/114933713734828735244/reviews", "language": "en", "original_language": "en", "profile_photo_url": "https://lh3.googleusercontent.com/a/ACg8ocIUeUR_8Q_hepN91SxvnGU-SNGPrBjJA2KhC3hkjD6fCfio8Q=s128-c0x00000000-cc-rp-mo-ba3", "rating": 5, "relative_time_description": "2 months ago", "text": "Dining at Mutra felt like stepping into my grandmother’s home—if my grandmother happened to be a world-class chef. From the moment we walked in, the space radiated warmth, care, and intention. The ambiance is immaculate—elegant yet comforting, with an atmosphere that invites you to relax, connect, and savor.

But the real magic begins with the food. Without exaggeration, this was some of the best kosher cuisine I’ve ever had. Each dish was layered with flavor, memory, and heart. You could tell that every bite was crafted with purpose.

Chef Raz, both the owner and mastermind behind the menu, is an absolute gem. Not only is he wildly talented, but he also took the time to come out, explain the dishes, and share his passion with us. He’s the kind of person who makes you feel like family from the very first hello. Mike and Jules were equally outstanding—attentive, kind, and incredibly professional.

Every detail, down to the shape of the wine glasses and the texture of the cups, felt thought through and deliberate. This wasn’t just a dinner—it was an experience. A soulful, flavorful, memorable experience.

Mutra is a gift to the kosher culinary world and to Miami at large. I can’t wait to return.", "time": 1746158144, "translated": false}, {"author_name": "David", "author_url": "https://www.google.com/maps/contrib/112892685249396471136/reviews", "language": "en", "original_language": "en", "profile_photo_url": "https://lh3.googleusercontent.com/a/ACg8ocJc3ZbYnQi7CNpJTX7iPb-aMCvBfYQCDIHTlPr5KLtQuxH1tw=s128-c0x00000000-cc-rp-mo", "rating": 5, "relative_time_description": "a month ago", "text": "This meal changed the way I feel about food altogether.
This was a living, breathing expression of beauty, culture, precision, and love — plated.
You could taste the care, the history, the pride. The food wasn’t just delicious; it was transporting. I sat there genuinely in awe.

Chef Raz? A genius!!
Every plate felt like it was crafted just for me. Like he knew exactly what I didn’t even know I was craving.

Every little detail in the design, the service, the rhythm of the night… it was superb.
There is elegance in this place. Not the kind you see in overpriced fine dining rooms. The rare kind — the kind that comes from true talented individuals.

I walked in hungry. I walked out grateful.
Thank you Chef Raz and all the talented minds that created this gem.", "time": 1750352391, "translated": false}, {"author_name": "Oren Kanel", "author_url": "https://www.google.com/maps/contrib/104639795175409573569/reviews", "language": "en", "original_language": "en", "profile_photo_url": "https://lh3.googleusercontent.com/a-/ALV-UjXuNAOmFT2uScrhnFWKZp0uukhivMy10nlFeaHEdmDu2zDpjMA5=s128-c0x00000000-cc-rp-mo-ba3", "rating": 5, "relative_time_description": "5 months ago", "text": "So I went here for my birthday and wow. Chef Shabtai is very humble and personable. He really nailed it with naming it after his grandmother. You feel you’re in his grandmothers kitchen with the ambiance and designing. All I can say is she must’ve been an excellent teacher and, he, an excellent student. We ordered the tar tar, chicken liver, fish risotto, and eat the mountain (chicken). All A+. Shabtai even gave me a free glass of wine for my birthday. The ambiance is perfect. Unlike so many kosher places that push cocktail menus a whole page long because everyone knows that’s where a bulk of profit is, none of that was here, which is extremely respectful and preferable as he fully focuses on the food, and it shows. Prices are extremely reasonable as well. Last thing I’ll mention is as long as this place doesn’t go down the same rabbit hole of most kosher places of service declining, food quality declining, and prices increasing, Shabtai will be very successful and have a following. Mazal tov chef on your journey and can’t wait to come back soon!!", "time": 1740616671, "translated": false}, {"author_name": "Nd10", "author_url": "https://www.google.com/maps/contrib/108191847183490389161/reviews", "language": "en", "original_language": "en", "profile_photo_url": "https://lh3.googleusercontent.com/a/ACg8ocJehnU5SpfU0uunXtu0JrG6UbpxbHZN5xsFRpgdaDvY1TZ15w=s128-c0x00000000-cc-rp-mo-ba3", "rating": 5, "relative_time_description": "2 weeks ago", "text": "I cannot express enough, how good the food is and the service is exceptional. Highly recommended will be an understatement. If you want to eat like the chef cooked only for you the best food ever you come to MUTRA", "time": 1752106607, "translated": false}]

[{"author_name": "Aaron Mahg", "author_url": "https://www.google.com/maps/contrib/101788316347361095483/reviews", "language": "en", "original_language": "en", "profile_photo_url": "https://lh3.googleusercontent.com/a/ACg8ocJQXXTXNA2Z9tKjE_BtZVJatF03u5DW1vWa8B5-ALN8VGluvw=s128-c0x00000000-cc-rp-mo-ba3", "rating": 5, "relative_time_description": "4 months ago", "text": "One of my favorite restaurants. Been here close to 10 times and I never get tired of it. All the food is always super fresh, drinks are amazing, service is wonderful, and the atmosphere is terrific.", "time": 1741810487, "translated": false}, {"author_name": "Adam Rosenblum", "author_url": "https://www.google.com/maps/contrib/105919449855359699716/reviews", "language": "en", "original_language": "en", "profile_photo_url": "https://lh3.googleusercontent.com/a-/ALV-UjWqFLUq7gX-CZGWqQDTvFTeJq3WprauWW4fNyxlHkpI_iFaE_cWLw=s128-c0x00000000-cc-rp-mo-ba3", "rating": 5, "relative_time_description": "a year ago", "text": "The food is good, creative, and aesthetically pleasing. This is mostly a tapas place so expect the portion sizes to be on the smaller side (they do have a limited selection of entrees). The place has a nice vibe and the music is at a tasteful volume compared to the other kosher place right next door. A few other notes: at first it wasn't easy to find because there is no signage on top of the building like all the other stores. I know they aren't the only place that does this, and I understand why they do it, but personally I'm not a fan of the mandatory 20% tip. By definition a gratuity should be optional and variable based on the quality of the service. Without the ability to lower the percentage it doesn't exactly encourage good service (although in theory people could give more than 20% I assume people rarely do). And, because it's mandatory, what it really feels like is a psychological pricing trick where you're really paying 20% on top of the menu prices but you don't think about it when you make your selections. In our case the service was decent but not exactly stellar (we had the place to ourselves and it didn't seem like the staff was doting on us though they had nothing else to do). PS. They seem to have a bit of an obsession with sashito peppers not sure why it appears in so many dishes relative to their small menu.", "time": 1701229882, "translated": false}, {"author_name": "Shlomo Yusupov", "author_url": "https://www.google.com/maps/contrib/105783658573142534204/reviews", "language": "en", "original_language": "en", "profile_photo_url": "https://lh3.googleusercontent.com/a/ACg8ocI6yKPWmdL0d5i7D1one8ARo5gdMG9PynHBwj4d7VinUQaSmA=s128-c0x00000000-cc-rp-mo-ba3", "rating": 4, "relative_time_description": "2 months ago", "text": "Overall good experience some of the drinks are a hit or a miss.", "time": 1747314753, "translated": false}, {"author_name": "Kosher Food World", "author_url": "https://www.google.com/maps/contrib/110352001477487610343/reviews", "language": "en", "original_language": "en", "profile_photo_url": "https://lh3.googleusercontent.com/a-/ALV-UjWOwmXC49mG6kvANDPsMOne4vj73tWyI4DFg2AQe6LoFPc3pDs=s128-c0x00000000-cc-rp-mo-ba5", "rating": 5, "relative_time_description": "a year ago", "text": "We came here to try out a variety of dishes, and taste we did!

For starters, they offered lemon or lime slices with your table water, my husband loves his lemon water so this was a nice touch of service!

Here’s what we ordered:

⭐️ The street corn 🌽
This was the star of the night! It had a sweet and spicy soy glaze and also a truffle aioli on top, and they played together very nicely for the perfect bite. Highly recommended.

⭐️ The Ceviche 🎣
I have to say that you can tell that they put a lot of effort into their flavors. The ceviche was phenomenal and we’d return for this dish alone.

We also ordered the deconstructed tuna tartare, beef skewers, beef carpaccio, and beef gyozos. They were good dishes. My one complaint is that they used the same sauces across multiple dishes and I would have loved to taste a variety of their clearly talented chef.

The waiter said they will be changing up the menu in a bit. We’re looking forward to seeing what they bring!

Oh they also have incredible drinks. Enjoy!", "time": 1701219330, "translated": false}, {"author_name": "Sarah Marisol Verschleisser", "author_url": "https://www.google.com/maps/contrib/117969692698815539528/reviews", "language": "en", "original_language": "en", "profile_photo_url": "https://lh3.googleusercontent.com/a-/ALV-UjVFXu2xkuZobnfp_NgavLWbb05G9rmfR47ko9PSMX6W4N338GB7XA=s128-c0x00000000-cc-rp-mo-ba3", "rating": 5, "relative_time_description": "a year ago", "text": "Absolutely recommend going to OKI. A very chill fancy vibe. The waitresses are extremely friendly and on top of their service. The food was amazing. I will say you do need to get 3 mains each person just to fill up because it’s a little bit more that appetizer size but that’s their whole shtick. I 100% recommend going here for a unique date night experience.", "time": 1703628209, "translated": false}]

[{"author_name": "Gc Pro", "author_url": "https://www.google.com/maps/contrib/116452533532188720161/reviews", "language": "en", "original_language": "en", "profile_photo_url": "https://lh3.googleusercontent.com/a-/ALV-UjXbwYvNFkK6A4HoWyrtZcfVWSH7TX4UxcoIcmZNKIXLrL8ZxH4=s128-c0x00000000-cc-rp-mo", "rating": 5, "relative_time_description": "6 months ago", "text": "Last Thursday, I brought my team here for a company event, and I couldn’t be happier with the experience. From the moment we walked in, the energy of the restaurant was incredible. Despite it being a busy night, the atmosphere felt lively and welcoming without feeling chaotic.

The food was absolutely amazing—each dish was thoughtfully prepared, perfectly seasoned, and beautifully presented. Every member of my team was raving about their meals, and it’s clear that the kitchen staff puts genuine care and passion into their work.

The service was equally impressive. Even with the restaurant being packed, we were made to feel like the only table there. The staff was attentive, professional, and personable, ensuring that every detail of our evening was taken care of seamlessly. Drinks were refilled promptly, special requests were handled without hesitation, and they even took the time to ask if everything was to our liking multiple times throughout the night.

This restaurant really sets the standard for how to handle large groups without sacrificing quality or service. I genuinely recommend this place to anyone looking for incredible food, outstanding service, and a vibrant atmosphere. Whether it’s for a company event like ours or a personal dinner, you won’t be disappointed. We’ll definitely be back soon!", "time": 1737301017, "translated": false}, {"author_name": "The Chef’s View", "author_url": "https://www.google.com/maps/contrib/109600887918412416061/reviews", "language": "en", "original_language": "en", "profile_photo_url": "https://lh3.googleusercontent.com/a-/ALV-UjWnveo7Q8Zk-KdGG8uQi-PtVNH6e2hmfGH0tFyI73iAW0YWoGhi=s128-c0x00000000-cc-rp-mo-ba6", "rating": 5, "relative_time_description": "2 years ago", "text": "My family and I ate at Px Mediterranean Grill last week in Fort Lauderdale, Florida.

They specialize in Kosher Foods and the flavors were out of this world 🌍 good 💫

We started w the Arais $17.95 (Ground Beef Kabob Grilled to perfection in a Pita 🫓 Pocket) That is what the menu stated, and it was true, it was absolutely grilled to perfection!!!! The flavors were on point and this might have been my favorite flavor of the night.

We ordered the Fried Combo $19.95 (Pastel 3 Pcs, Cigar 3 Pcs, Kibbeh 3pc)  I absolutely love fried things so we had to try the combo. You could tell they use fresh oil because there was no taste of old fry oil, I really appreciate that. The textures were spot on, and I enjoyed all three selections.

I ordered the Schnitzel Plate 2 Pcs. $31.95 and it came w fries. This dish was really good and executed well. It also came w rice and this stews okra w tomato sauce on top. It was very good and added a great complement of acidity to the dish.

They also brought complimentary side items to go w the meal that was really good. Seriously, all the flavors were on point 💫

My wife order the Greek Salad With Vegan Feta $17.95 It was good. I asked the waiter why vegan feta and he said because they were Kosher. I thought that was cool 😎

For dessert we ordered a Peanut Butter Dome $12.95 & a Chocolate Dome $12.95 The presentation was fabulous! They were decadent, rich and over the top. Everything a dessert should be 😉 I am a huge peanut butter fan and always have to order if I see a dessert w it. So so glad we did!

PX Mediterranean Grill
3558 N Ocean Blvd,
Fort Lauderdale, FL 33308

[{"author_name": "Lior Lev", "author_url": "https://www.google.com/maps/contrib/107542517046624581980/reviews", "language": "en", "original_language": "en", "profile_photo_url": "https://lh3.googleusercontent.com/a-/ALV-UjUsSJ473P_PESiW4MIfrfscUiysh1U3e6dToBLQ_hm3RNVEUVMkkQ=s128-c0x00000000-cc-rp-mo-ba5", "rating": 1, "relative_time_description": "a month ago", "text": "We’ve eaten at this restaurant before and absolutely loved it. We even left five glowing reviews a year ago because the food was so fresh and flavorful. That’s exactly why my wife and I came back again for a late lunch after work. Sadly, this time was a major letdown.

Even before ordering, we asked the server about the freshness of the laffa bread. She reassured us it had just come out, but when we received it, it was cold, stale, and fell apart like it had been frozen and just defrosted. It was anything but fresh.

The hummus was extremely salty, to the point that I’m still burping from it hours later. The fries were clearly not homemade. You could taste that they were frozen and processed.

Nothing sat well. Unfortunately, this isn’t the first time we’ve had a disappointing experience here since that great visit last year. We really wanted to give it another chance, but this time it was just too far gone.

It pains me to write this because I genuinely want to support kosher places in our community. I still believe this restaurant has potential. The food used to be amazing. I truly hope the owners read this and take it to heart. We came back with high hopes and left very disappointed.
