restaurants.full_description: A wonderful kosher restaurant offering delicious food in a warm, welcoming atmosphere.
restaurants.google_reviews: [{"author_name": "David Rosenman", "author_url": "https://www.google.com/maps/contrib/109520567017702358184/reviews", "language": "en", "original_language": "en", "profile_photo_url": "https://lh3.googleusercontent.com/a/ACg8ocJK73vDpyQxXRJ7JpVkv9Eni03F0IBh1eS_dUUrg9j1unciDg=s128-c0x00000000-cc-rp-mo-ba5", "rating": 5, "relative_time_description": "a month ago", "text": "I passed by this place a few weeks ago when I was in Delray and was curious so I googled it later to see 4.9 stars out of 133 reviews. So I had to try it. I took my Dad who loves Middle Eastern and Mediterranean food here for a Father's Day lunch. Everything was perfect. The place is really clean, ORB certificate for those who keep a kosher diet, dairy free kitchen. With the best falafel I've had outside of Israel! Loads of coriander crispy outside and tender almost fluffy inside, really great! The schwarma Turkey on the fire roasted vertical spit was on point!!! I ordered the Schwarma Laffa. The Laffa was tender yet sturdy and toasted warm and soft. Held all of the beautiful toppings in there, carrots, beets, Israeli salad, pickles, sumac onions, hummus, babaganoush, shug, eggplant salad and cabbage salads. Everything was Flavorful/Nostalgic to how I remember it tasting like when I visited Israel many years ago. 100% would recommend this place to everyone. Cannot wait to go back. Have plans this week already for another lunch there. I brought home the pargiyot chicken platter for my wife who loved everything as well. This is very reasonably priced for the portion and definitely worth it in terms of flavor. A lot of times kosher restaurants are extremely overpriced but I think for everything their prices are fair and worth it!", "time": 1750017255, "translated": false}, {"author_name": "Allan DiSimone", "author_url": "https://www.google.com/maps/contrib/113796866873717603246/reviews", "language": "en", "original_language": "en", "profile_photo_url": "https://lh3.googleusercontent.com/a-/ALV-UjWagV6FUhff8WhCJaURk_RR8MGX7eRLDk0FRrExkn-aGaUY3Nxg=s128-c0x00000000-cc-rp-mo-ba5", "rating": 5, "relative_time_description": "6 months ago", "text": "Extremely clean and neat Israeli shawarma deli which makes its own wraps and pita\u2019s. I had the sandwich in their homemade pita, which was unbelievable, soft, warm and made the perfect vehicle to carry the messy load, without breaking\u2026.just wonderful. I ordered the chicken shawarma pita, and it was hands down one of the best I’ve had — juicy, well-seasoned, and wrapped in soft, warm pita bread. What really sets this place apart is the attention to detail and the care they put into each dish. The staff is friendly and attentive, making sure everything is just right. Whether you’re grabbing a quick bite or sitting down for a meal with family or friends, Pita Plus delivers every time.

GF options, incredibly clever drink menu and whimsical on the mark funky Mexican decor. We had the fish tacos, carne asada quesadilla, a starter with quac and another yummy huge appetizer with well spiced meat. Hubby had a drink called The Convict. He was a repeat offender. I had a non alcoholic frozen mango delight. The whole night was a delight. Music not too loud and large screen tvs for NBA playoffs were great to sit and chill with. The bar looks fun too . restaurants.google_reviews:
[{"author_name": "Ari C", "author_url": "https://www.google.com/maps/contrib/114087000941551566312/reviews", "language": "en", "original_language": "en", "profile_photo_url": "https://lh3.googleusercontent.com/a-/ALV-UjWWsjxlhtaQNk9_K17YBXC8jyCNFx7HYHynooksq-Bxy2FNyR0n=s128-c0x00000000-cc-rp-mo-ba4", "rating": 5, "relative_time_description": "a month ago", "text": "Went on Saturday night they opened at 10pm (should update the hours it’s listed as opening at 930 on google).
You know it’s good when there is a line of people waiting for them to open at 10pm.

Ordered a double smash and fries.

The burger was excellent, very flavorful juicy. I was worried about the vegan cheese but it tasted great and I couldn’t really tell. Overall an excellent smash burger with high quality meat. Great crust on the burger and good bun. I’ll be coming back just for this.

The fries were also very good and they give you a good amount. Very crispy on the outside and fluffy on the inside. Salted well.

I didn’t love the smash sauce but it wasn’t bad, just not my style. It’s very different than most smash sauces. It had a smoky flavor and darker color, again it was good just not my preference.  I’ll try a different sauce next time.

Will definitely be frequenting here it’s fantastic and I highly recommend!", "time": 1750003355, "translated": false}, {"author_name": "Esther Amram", "author_url": "https://www.google.com/maps/contrib/103495659650095071574/reviews", "language": "en", "original_language": "en", "profile_photo_url": "https://lh3.googleusercontent.com/a-/ALV-UjWNV_WSbQLxjRcuVR7fnLe2ABgiRrpogROGqtISZRj8_W8NRxGBlQ=s128-c0x00000000-cc-rp-mo-ba2", "rating": 5, "relative_time_description": "2 weeks ago", "text": "What an amazing experience we had at Smash House! I found the prices to be surprisingly reasonable, especially for a kosher restaurant. We’d love to see a location open up closer to home!", "time": 1741563862, "translated": false}, {"author_name": "Marcelo Doro", "author_url": "https://www.google.com/maps/contrib/105284608571075249101/reviews", "language": "en", "original_language": "en", "profile_photo_url": "https://lh3.googleusercontent.com/a-/ALV-UjVSn28b3dYswwAtbuVjrcpCnp5Y6NrR_OQifuWs6JdxDcagWFtR=s128-c0x00000000-cc-rp-mo-ba2", "rating": 5, "relative_time_description": "3 weeks ago", "text": "Smash House is solid. What really makes it stand out is being able to build your own burger from a bunch of toppings and sauces. You can keep it classic or go all in with different combos, which is a nice touch.
Prices are fair, especially for the quality you’re getting. Definitely worth checking out if you’re into good burgers and want something made your way.", "time": 1751828676, "translated": false}, {"author_name": "Common Man Eats", "author_url": "https://www.google.com/maps/contrib/113332379523325961079/reviews", "language": "en", "original_language": "en", "profile_photo_url": "https://lh3.googleusercontent.com/a-/ALV-UjX67WA0p8ExyT3MaQKYi8yTemoqc9zwH534lcaeSb5R14PJk7sg=s128-c0x00000000-cc-rp-mo-ba6", "rating": 5, "relative_time_description": "3 months ago", "text": "We tried Smash House Boca today for lunch and it was definitely on point. All were amazing but the 305 stole my heart. It was simple but soooo good. The burger, onions, and cheese was all I needed. Overall, this place was amazing and I would definitely come back. Looking forward to trying the blooming onion they have for sure. I would also love to add that they offer golden tickets to random kids meals that give kids a chance to win a great prize. I think it’s great that they are doing this and I’ll definitely support them.", "time": 1743384795, "translated": false}]

The server told me that they only had a small amount of old oat milk left and that she would have to charge me extra for it. Despite telling me that the oat milk was old, she began to make my coffee with it anyway. I told her that if there was not enough fresh oat milk and she was going to charge me extra regardless, to please change it to almond milk.
When I went to pay, the cashier noticed that I only received one side with my order and instructed the server to give me the second side. The server’s demeanor was incredibly sour, and she reluctantly served me with an attitude.
Upon returning to my office to eat my breakfast, I discovered that my toast was white bread slathered in butter, despite my explicit request for whole wheat toast with no butter. I even asked the server to confirm it was whole wheat when I was placing the order.
This experience was dreadful. It's a prime example of how a lack of politeness and attention to detail can severely damage the reputation of an establishment.
I will never return to this place.", "time": 1687962400, "translated": false}, {"author_name": "Ashley Tollison", "author_url": "https://www.google.com/maps/contrib/104052604052823980068/reviews", "language": "en", "original_language": "en", "profile_photo_url": "https://lh3.googleusercontent.com/a-/ALV-UjUMW09jF_G0kQJrZoBlX4uHGi74IXUwFmHCV_MAgOyC68InWxvt=s128-c0x00000000-cc-rp-mo-ba4", "rating": 2, "relative_time_description": "3 years ago", "text": "What a horrible experience 😞 I've been to this location a few times and service is okay. The lunch rush started and about 4 people ordered salad as well and received it and I was still waiting. I asked the cashier at 12:15 if they had an order for me and the lady making the salad waved it and began making other orders after I explained calmly I had been waiting for 30 minutes. Another salad order came out and then when it was time to make mine I'm not sure if she was just being spiteful but my salad took another 10 minutes to come out. After everything and I finally got my salad I paid and walked away only to find that my card was charged $2 more then the order so I'm assuming the cashier tipped herself because I didn't hit the no reviept option on the screen. Atmosphere was good with a few others dinning in and outside. I think music would have been a nice addition though.

Food - My husband and I ordered the Açaí Fruit Bowl and Strawberry Passion Fruit Smoothie. The smoothie was amazingly and tasted exactly as expected with strong strawberry flavor while not being too overpowering on the sweetness. The Açaí Fruit Bowl was delicious. The fruit looked and tasted very fresh. I did wish I had paid for the additional almond butter or peanut butter drizzle on top of the bowl, however at an extra $3.50, I decided against it when ordering.

Service - no greeting when entering or when standing at the cash register. At least not that I heard, the girl behind the counter stopped what she was doing once we were ready to order. She changed her gloves before switching from food prep to cashier. She was friendly and smiled; but was a little hard to hear her voice due to mask. We sat at the bar and watched the food while it was prepared. I appreciated the cleanliness of the preparation space and the care that the women took while preparing the meal.

Note - use of Greenprint straws and 100% recycled napkins.

Overall very happy with the experience and will be back again! restaurants.google_reviews:
[{"author_name": "Orel Bitton", "author_url": "https://www.google.com/maps/contrib/110081499664549414712/reviews", "language": "en", "original_language": "en", "profile_photo_url": "https://lh3.googleusercontent.com/a/ACg8ocLWgOnJfKCyXaqXChPhnv69p_oBOw79fdmaKB49eJYH_iuMdw=s128-c0x00000000-cc-rp-mo", "rating": 5, "relative_time_description": "5 months ago", "text": "Amazing Venue and Great Service!!!
I hosted my daughter’s Bat Mitzvah at The W Boynton Beach, and it was absolutely perfect! The venue has two event halls, and I chose the larger one, which was beautifully set up. There’s also a stunning lake view outside by the golf course, making it a great option for outdoor events.

Highly recommend the Jewish Toast for your sandwich!", "time": 1717175084, "translated": false}, {"author_name": "Joshua Nowack", "author_url": "https://www.google.com/maps/contrib/107282554864767137539/reviews", "language": "en", "original_language": "en", "profile_photo_url": "https://lh3.googleusercontent.com/a/ACg8ocKeiU0bR0FPxmvGKQDgbe8FImgqrHFkSTp4m11wJ-0K-7tSiA=s128-c0x00000000-cc-rp-mo-ba2", "rating": 5, "relative_time_description": "3 months ago", "text": "I didn’t even really order anything. I just said I was modestly hungry, and they took it from there — and honestly, they couldn't have read the situation better.

Pretty sure it was a mix of pastrami, Mexican turkey, regular turkey, and some of their chipotle mayo (which was absolutely divine). The soft sesame bread was light but held it all together perfectly — just the right foundation for a sandwich like that.

The conversation while I waited was one of those easy, pleasant ones that makes you feel like you’re a regular, even if you’re just passing through. Super delicious, just-right kind of meal for when you’re on the road and a little hungry but not trying to overdo it.

Really glad I stopped. Places like this are rare.", "time": 1745837973, "translated": false}, {"author_name": "Evie Thompson", "author_url": "https://www.google.com/maps/contrib/108203744908171949976/reviews", "language": "en", "original_language": "en", "profile_photo_url": "https://lh3.googleusercontent.com/a-/ALV-UjWU-QVlNMsZPHeaiWxt6-CMfbJMO6HF0xFw6CgZd9CPExFD97I=s128-c0x00000000-cc-rp-mo", "rating": 5, "relative_time_description": "3 weeks ago", "text": "Hands down the BEST toasted sandwich I've ever eaten! Built my own sandwich on Jerusalem Toast, with Shoulder Beef Pastrami, Mexican Turkey, a green spicy spread, lettuce, tomatoes, onion, & topped it off with Jalepeno Aioli. The restaurant was clean, the ingredients were fresh, & the gentleman that made our sandwiches was friendly & kind! Thank you for being open late & for serving delicious food!", "time": 1751425865, "translated": false}]
